concept-wr.title: Titanium Server Installation Overview
concept-wr.shortdesc: Installing Titanium Server involves loading and configuring the software on a combined controller/compute controller node, and then using this node to load the software on a second combined controller/compute node. controller node, two storage nodes, and two or more compute nodes.

conbody.p: Before installation, ensure that you are familiar with the Titanium Server architecture, and that your hardware meets the minimum requirements. For more information, refer to Titanium Server Planning.
Review the Wind River Titanium Server Release Notes for any additional information pertaining to installation.
During installation, have ready the following items:

li.p: the Titanium Server ISO image on bootable media, or a PXE boot server
a configuration plan for use during the installation process
CGTS-4255(optional) a CA-signed certificate, for secure HTTPS access for REST API applications and the web server

(optional) A firewall rules file, if you need to override or augment the Titanium Server default firewall settings. Normally this is not required. For more information, refer to Titanium Server System Administration:.
(optional) a controller configuration input file, if you want to use automated initial configuration
